intro: Calyxhymenia chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean calyxhymenia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, specifically Chile. It belongs to the family Calycaraceae and is characterized by its simple, herbaceous structure. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. Its calyx is prominent and persists throughout the flowering period, giving the plant its scientific name. Calyxhymenia chilensis is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native range.
